column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Six Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Saturday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 846 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Saturday
column5: 690 on Friday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.Last updated 20 November at 14:30 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column8: 394 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Friday.Last updated 20 November at 14:30 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 5959 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Saturday
column10: 138 on Friday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column13: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 640 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals.There are 121 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units.Last updated 20 November at 14:30 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column15: 445 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Thursday.A total of 3
column17: 288 people have had their first dose and 3
column20: 319 people have received a single dose and 63
column21: 821 immunocompromised people have received their third dose.Last updated 18 November at 14:00 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
